author: Valerie Bauerlein
title: Boy Scouts to Drop ‘Boy’ From Name of Main Scouting Program
text:
The Boy Scouts of America is changing the name of its marquee scouting program to reflect last fall’s historic decision to include girls.
The Boy Scouts program for children aged 11 to 17 will lose the “boy” and be renamed Scouts BSA, effective in February of next year, said Michael Surbaugh, chief executive of Boy Scouts of America. Already about 3,000 girls are participating in a new early-adopter program for Cub Scouts aged 5 to 10, Mr. Surbaugh said, and girls will be able to join at all levels in 2019.
